Def.Name: Amur Cork-Tree
Def.Description: A medium sized tree 30' - 50', with a spreading often flat-topped crown. Up to a 24" diameter trunk.
Def.Leaves: Opposite, pinnately compound, 7 to 11 ovate to elliptical leaflets, oval, long pointed tips, 2" - 4" long with entire leaf 11" - 14", shiny dark green above, much paler below. Aromatic when chrushed, yellow in autumn.
Def.Twigs: Stout, lustrous brown, numerous lighter lenticels; large raised U-shaped leaf scars encircles a fuzzy brown broadly conical bud; inner bark of twigs bright yellow.
Def.SeedConeOrFruit: Fruit: : Black 3/8" diameter drupe in 2" -4" long clusters, ripen in early fall and persist through the winter. 5 seeded with turpentine odor when chrused.
Def.Bark: Dark gray, ridged and furrowed, becomes quite thick with corky ridges.
Def.Range: Hardy to zone 3b. Introduced from northern China.
Def.Remarks: Nice ornamental tree that likes moist well drained soils. Phellodendron is used by the Chinese for osteoarthritis, weight loss, obesity, diarrhea, ulcers, etc...but its not recommended ;)
